title: I'm suspicious that Graves was left super strong for months in the jungle just to justify this skin
body: Graves was so overtuned for months that it now seems frustrating that Riot more than likely allowed him to be stronger than all the other junglers to justify the victorious skin. Maybe I'm wrong, but this seems like an unhealthy think to do if that was in case the reason for his 6+ month domination of everybody else. I think I wasted my time writing 2 dozen posts on boards about how it was shocking that Graves was allowed to have a faster clear, be tankier, and do more damage than all the other junglers while maintaining full health, scaling well into all levels of the game and having the ability of being ranged.

replies.body:
I gotta disagree, they hit that man with insane nerfs patch after patch. 
Things like removing an animation cancel, true grit no longer giving him mr, the base dmg on his q, and the cooldown of his Q and R. 

Tbh, its annoying how much harder they nerf damage people that are on top, and we gotta sit with ardents, it's supports, and very strong tanks for months.

Bad game design is why it was hard to put that man down imo
how is graves overtuned? didn't he get like a major nerf to his dash that made him much less tankier.
He isn't anymore but he used to be a 20% play rate for months because he just stomped other junglers.
people only see what they want to see
